intro: Allionia hirsuta var. rotundifolia, commonly known as the roundleaf allionia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
